content.raw: That is very kind of you. Thank you.
content.html: That is very kind of you. Thank you.

update.description:
Not all the service requests require a response. We'd add some logic for removing the service request handler after sending the request, instead of waiting for the response. We could use the msgs::Empty for not having to modify the wire format when sending a service request. We'd create a new Request function in the Node class with only one parameter (the input parameter).

Two examples are included SrvProviderOneway and RequesterOneway.

Integration tests are also added.
update.title: Service requests without response

content.raw: @amtj Could you create a separate pull request for updating the `Using services` section of the tutorials?
content.html: @amtj Could you create a separate pull request for updating the Using services section of the tutorials?

content.raw:
This line generates some warnings on Windows. Could you replace it with this block until we fix the warnings in Ignition Messages?


```
#!c++

// ToDo: Remove after fixing the warnings
#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(push, 0)
#endif
#include <ignition/msgs.hh>
#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(pop)
#endif
```

And could you do the same thing with all the examples that include this line please?

content.raw: The value received as a parameter here won't be `5`. The value will be increasing with each call. I'd suggest to check that the value is `>= 0` and remove `g_data`.
content.html: The value received as a parameter here won't be 5. The value will be increasing with each call. I'd suggest to check that the value is >= 0 and remove g_data.

content.html:
See my previous comment. This should fix it. I'd also check that the callback was executed:

bool executed = false;

std::function<void(const ignition::msgs::Int32 &)> advCb =
    [&executed](const ignition::msgs::Int32 &_req)
{
  EXPECT_EQ(_req.data(), data);
  executed = true;
};

transport::Node node;
EXPECT_TRUE((node.Advertise<ignition::msgs::Int32>(g_topic, advCb)));

ignition::msgs::Int32 req;
req.set_data(data);

EXPECT_TRUE(node.Request(g_topic, req));
EXPECT_TRUE(executed);

content.raw: You're missing an `&` in the lambda declaration.
content.html: You're missing an & in the lambda declaration.

content.raw:
How about: "Advertise and request a service without waiting for response."

This type of request is always asynchronous.
content.html:
How about: "Advertise and request a service without waiting for response."

This type of request is always asynchronous.
